text: Tomatoes are seasonal in summer (June to September) in temperate regions. Local field-grown tomatoes have a carbon footprint of about 0.35 kg CO2e/kg. Greenhouse tomatoes in winter, however, cause up to 9.3 kg CO2e/kg. Water consumption is about 180L/kg. Alternative: Use seasonal peppers or zucchini.
Beef has a very high carbon footprint averaging 13.3 kg CO2e/kg. Water consumption is about 15,400L/kg. Alternative protein sources: Legumes like lentils (0.9 kg CO2e/kg) or tofu (2 kg CO2e/kg).

Potatoes are a sustainable staple food with a carbon footprint of only 0.2 kg CO2e/kg. They are available year-round locally and have a water consumption of about 290L/kg. Ideal for regional and seasonal cooking.

metadata.storage_life: several months when stored cool and dark

text: Rice has a medium carbon footprint of 2.7 kg CO2e/kg and a very high water consumption of 2,500L/kg. Alternative: Local grain varieties like spelt (0.8 kg CO2e/kg) or millet.
